work.p: This manuscript is a draft (or, less likely, a later version) of loc.00216, which was originally inscribed as part of the early manuscript poem "Pictures." The first several lines of "Pictures" were revised and published as "My Picture-Gallery" in the 30 October 1880 issue of The American. The poem was later published in Leaves of Grass as part of the "Autumn Rivulets" cluster (1881, p. 310)

titleStmt.title: The shower of meteors
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: This manuscript is written in the bottom margin of a page clipped from the September 1849 issue of Sartain's Union Magazine of Literature and Art. Whitman probably wrote this note in the early 1850s, before the appearance of the first edition of Leaves of Grass in 1855. It is a draft (or, less likely, a later version) of lines that appear in loc.00216, which was originally inscribed as part of the early manuscript poem "Pictures" (yal.00081). Harold W. Blodgett and Sculley Bradley see "Pictures" as "an important preliminary, a kind of auspice of LG 1855" that shows Whitman's early attempts to turn his experiences and reading into verse. They note that Whitman apparently returned to the manuscript repeatedly over several decades and eventually reworked its first several lines as "My Picture-Gallery," a poem he published in the 30 October 1880 issue of The American. See Blodgett and Bradley, eds., Leaves of Grass: Comprehensive Reader's Edition (New York: New York University Press, 1965), 642–649.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Holograph memoranda and notes, unsigned and undated, written on 27 scraps of paper
bibl.orgName: The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, New York Public Library
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

revisionDesc.change: corrected publication date of Comprehensive Reader's Edition, based on Ken's review

body.p: The shower of meteors—This occurred in the night of 12th‑13th Nov. 1833—toward morning— —myriads in all directions, some with long shining white trains, some falling over each other like falling water—leaping, silent, white, the apparitions around up there in the sky over my head.
